data.text: Michael Patrick Cronan On January 1, 2013, Cronan died at his Berkeley home after a long battle with cancer.Maurice FosterHe died in 2010 after a three-year battle with pulmonary fibrosis.Richard Bradshaw (conductor)On August 15, 2007, at age 63, Bradshaw died after collapsing from an apparent heart attack while at Toronto Pearson International Airport.Endon MahmoodOn 20 October 2005, aged 64, Endon died after a long battle with breast cancer.Ron GreenwoodHe died on 9 February 2006, aged 84, after a long struggle with Alzheimer's disease.Lee Watson10 Watson died at home in Lafayette, IN in 1989 after a long struggle with Leukemia.Adam YauchYauch died at age 47 on May 4, 2012, after a three-year battle with salivary gland cancer.Calvin Russell (musician) On 3 April 2011, Russell died in Garfield, Texas, after a lengthy battle with liver cancer at the age of 62.Alex KotzkyAfter a struggle with kidney disease, Kotzky died in 1996.G?rard CrombacHe died in a hospice in Paris on November 18, 2005 after a long fight against cancer.Shinichi Suzuki (violinist)Shinichi Suzuki died at his home in Matsumoto, Japan on January 26, 1998, aged 99.John O'Neill (rugby league)He fought a long battle, but died on 9 August 1999 at the age of 56.James Gandolfini Gandolfini died on June 19, 2013, aged 51 in Italy, during a brief vacation in Rome.Jonathan DawsonOn 10 August 2013, Dawson died after a long battle with illness.Georg TintnerOn 2 October 1999, after a six-year struggle with cancer, he jumped to his death from the balcony of his 11th-storey Halifax apartment.James Wong (lyricist)Wong died of lung cancer after a four-year battle at the age of 64 in 24 November 2004 at 00:46.Shirley Verrett Verrett died in Ann Arbor, Michigan, aged 79, on November 5, 2010 from heart failure following an undisclosed illness.Wilson D. WatsonWilson'' Doug'' Watson died on December 19, 1994 in Russellville, Arkansas.Jack BuchananBuchanan died in London in 1957 from spinal cancer, when he was 66 years old.Juan Carlos P?rez L?pez (footballer born 1945) ; Barcelona Juan Carlos died on 16 January 2012 at the age of 66, in his hometown of Santander, after a long battle with illness.John J. ByrneByrne died on March 7, 2013 after a long struggle against cancer.Frank HassettGeneral Hassett died at his home on 11 June 2008 after a long battle with illness.Shirley PattersonPatterson had a long fight with cancer in her later years, and died in 1995 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.Nellie KingOn August 11, 2010 King died after a battle with Parkinson's disease.Neil Munro (actor)Munro died in London, Ontario, after a lengthy struggle with cancer, on July 13, 2009.Millie DeeganDeegan moved to Florida in 1976 and died at the age of 82 following a two-year battle with breast cancer.Antonio Cassese Antonio Cassese died in Florence on 21 October 2011, after a long fight with cancer.Marin DrinovHe died in the town in 1906 after a long fight with tuberculosis.Lowell LundstromHe died from Parkinson's disease on July 20, 2012 in Savage, Minnesota at the age of 72.William "Billy" LenoirOn March 28, 2007, Lenoir died after a long battle with thyroid cancer.Norman CollierHe died on 14 March 2013, aged 87, after a long battle with Parkinson's disease.Dalvanius Prime Prime died in 2002 in Hawera after a long battle with cancer.Ben Gannon (producer)He died in January 2007, aged 54, following a long battle with cancer.Boris ShteifonShteifon, who suffered from liver disease, died of a heart attack in Zagreb, Croatia, on April 30, 1945.Bud GrantBud's wife Pat died in 2009, succumbing to the effects of Parkinson's Disease.Edson ZvobgoZvobgo died on 22 August 2004 after a lengthy battle with cancer.Henry Taylor (racing driver) Taylor died on 24 October 2013 died in Vallauris, France after a long battle with ill health.Mart Kenney Kenney died on February 8, 2006, aged 95, following a lengthy battle with Alzheimer's and vascular dementia.Sinclair LewisLewis died in Rome on January 10, 1951, aged 65, from advanced alcoholism.Al SchottelkotteSchottelkotte died on Christmas Day 1996 at his Lawrenceburg, Indiana home, after a two-year battle with cancer.Len MorganLen Morgan died March 11, 2005, after a long battle with cancer.Mel StewartOn February 24, 2002, Mel Stewart died of Alzheimer's disease.Sara Montiel Montiel died in 2013 at her home in Madrid, Spain at the age of 85 from undisclosed causes.Eugene SledgeEugene Sledge died after a long battle with stomach cancer in 2001.Monte PearsonAfter a long battle with cancer, Pearson died on January 27, 1978 in Fresno, California at the age of 69 and was cremated.Cecil Chaudhry Cecil Chaudhry died at the age of 70 in Lahore on 13 April 2012 after a battle with lung cancer.Henry Marshall FurmanHe died after a lengthy illness, from Bright's Disease, on April 10, 1916.Alvin M. JohnstonJohnston developed Alzheimer's disease in the 1990s and died in 1998.Herman GoldstineGoldstine died on June 16, 2004 at his home in Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania after a long struggle with Parkinson's disease.Lhasa de Sela Following a 21-month-long battle with breast cancer, Lhasa died, age 37, on the evening of January 1, 2010, at her home in Montreal.Louise Kink Louise died on August 25, 1992, from lung cancer in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.Laza Ristovski Ristovski died in Belgrade on October 6, 2007 following a long battle with multiple sclerosis.Maureen Forrester Maureen Forrester died on 16 June 2010, aged 79, in Toronto, after a long battle with dementia.Pat Quinn (businessman) He died aged 74 in Canada on 23 November 2009 when he succumbed to renal failure.Reginald J. BrownAfter a battle with pancreatic cancer, Brown died in Solomons, Maryland on December 17, 2005.Edd GouldOn the morning of 25 March 2012, Gould died from leukemia and after a 6-year battle with cancer.Rosa Ponselle Ponselle died at her estate, Villa Pace, near Baltimore, Maryland on May 25, 1981, aged 84, after a long battle with bone marrow cancer.Jack KuehlerKuehler died at age 76 on December 20, 2008 in Rancho Santa Fe, California of complications related to Parkinson's disease.Keith Parkinson After a long battle with acute Myelogenous Leukemia (AML), Keith Parkinson died on 26 October 2005.Bunji Sakita He died on August 31, 2002 in Japan after a year-long battle with cancer.Tommy ProthroHe died in 1995 after a three-year battle with cancer.George Coulouris Coulouris died on 25 April 1989, of heart failure following Parkinson's disease in London.Mario ComensoliMario Comensoli died from a heart attack in his studio in Zurich on 2 June 1993.Edward Wilson (actor)Wilson was diagnosed with cancer in 2007 and, after a brave fight against the disease, died peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles.Antonia Bird Bird died from a rare anaplastic thyroid cancer on 24 October 2013 at the age of 62.Jo?o MoraisHe died on 27 April 2010 at 75, after a long battle with illness.Rudy LaRussoHe died of Parkinson's disease in 2004.Billy McKinney (politician) Billy McKinney died on July 15, 2010 in his southwest Atlanta home after a long struggle with cancer at the age of 83.Roger ScottRoger Scott died in 1989, at the age of 46, after a brief battle with cancer.Billy Todd He died the morning of November 30, 2008 after a long battle against Alzheimer's.Roland A. LuedtkeHe was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in his later years, and died on July 22, 2005.Brynle WilliamsHe died in April 2011 after an eight-month battle with the disease.Rae PerlinPerlin died on March 5, 2006 at St. John's after a long struggle with Alzheimer's disease.Gene BartowOn January 3, 2012, Gene Bartow died at his home in Birmingham after a two-year battle with the disease.Rogers MortonIn 1979, however, Morton died at his home at the age of 64 due to the cancer.Richard Clarke (frontiersman) Clarke died in 1930, at the age of 83 after an extended illness.Keith Black (engineer)Keith Black died from complications due to brain cancer in 1991.Bobby Robson On 31 July 2009, Robson died of lung cancer at his home in County Durham, aged 76, after a long battle with the disease.Bob EwingLong Bob Ewing died of cancer on June 20, 1947, at age 74.Carl Morton Morton died on April 12, 1983 in Tulsa, Oklahoma, of a heart attack after jogging.Vera RalstonShe died on February 9, 2003, in Santa Barbara, California, after a long battle with cancer.Donn ReynoldsHe died in Toronto on August 16, 1997 following complications from Alzheimer's disease.Ed Buchanan Buchanan died of Lou Gehrig's disease (ALS) causing paralysis in San Diego on August 31, 1991, at the age of 51.Bernard WilliamsHe died on 10 June 2003 while on holiday in Rome ; he had been suffering from multiple myeloma, a form of cancer.Mary LundbyLundby died on January 17, 2009 after a three-year battle with cervical cancer.Paddy Quinn (baseball)Quinn died, aged 59, from unknown causes in his native Chicago in 1909.Herbert Blaize He died in December 1989 near St. George's, Grenada, following a several years long battle with prostate cancer, aged 71.George KishKish died after a brief illness in Ann Arbor, Michigan, on July 11, 1989.Franck PourcelHe died on 12 November 2000 in Neuilly-sur-Seine, at the age of 87, from Parkinson's disease.Peter Bullfrog MooreMoore died in 2000, aged 68, after a long battle with throat cancer.Ceil ChapmanCeil Chapman died after a two-year battle with lung cancer on Friday, July 13, 1979.Bertha WilsonWilson died in an Ottawa retirement home on April 28, 2007 of an unspecified'' prolonged illness'' which some sources claim was Alzheimer's disease.Mel Smilow On December 26, 2002, at the age of 81, Mel Smilow died after suffering from Alzheimer's disease.Tonino Delli ColliTonino Delli Colli died from a heart attack in 2005 at the age of 81 in Rome, Italy.Bibi Besch Bibi Besch died on September 7, 1996 at age 56 following a long battle with breast cancer.
